no one its changing anything here those where are images...also "hopefully =
they will be able to do so in a visual form". 
How can you say Hopefully..t=
hey do this alll the time through smoke,black mirrors, etc..if you KNOW the=
 can change soundwaves why is the leap so huge for you to believe they can =
do this on through visual form...one of those faces I have seen with my own=
 eyes in my home..but I'm sure you don't believe that either which is ok. I=
'm not hear to convince anyone anything..maybe you will try it out a few mo=
re times and it will work for you maybe not,also I may be wrong but what wo=
rks for one does not always work for everyone. Hence Boxs,digital evp, etc.=
.I have a very close relationship with spirit as I'm sure alot of you do..m=
aybe this sort of thing they have to want you to see..maybe thats why your =
not on your end
=C2=A0
maybe I shouldn't said anything about this...people =
are not ready
Good luck
=C2=A0
singing Kum Ba Yah now :)

at they can manipulate soundwaves, hopefully they will be able to do so in =
a visual form.


Tim

ligent than anyone else. I've been doing EVP related work for ten years, th=
at does not mean I have had no other experience, have not read a butt load =
of books, and have no intuition-. I've been having "paranormal expereince" =
before most of=C2=A0the people on this group were born, and it really pisse=
s me off to be talked down to.=C2=A0 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0I say the images are rea=
l, and are not at all rare, and once again I state--we are the ones with al=
l the limitations! If someone on the other side has been working on technol=
ogy for 1000 years, how simple do you think it is for them to embed images =
in every and any=C2=A0freaking thing they want to? Forget the Hollywood non=
sense of spirit being a deminished human zombie incapable of any action on =
this side.
=C2=A0

On Sun, Dec 19, 2010 at 3:49 PM, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wr=
ote:


=C2=A0 



Frank, 


WTF?


Did I second guess anyone? =C2=A0No.


D=
id I prejudge all evidence? =C2=A0No.


Was I aware of this? =C2=A0Yes. =C2=
=A0Did I mention it before? =C2=A0No. =C2=A0Why? =C2=A0Because it did not i=
nterest me until now because I did not know the software was available for =
downloading.


You are putting a helluva lot of assumptions out there about=
 me Frank, and you know me better than to ever equate me with the TAPS bull=
shit. =C2=A0At least I thought you did.


All I can ask is WTF? =C2=A0Can n=
o one understand basic English in a freaking post anymore? =C2=A0


I attac=
ked no one. =C2=A0I attacked no evidence. =C2=A0I did not give specific opi=
nion about the validity of evidence until forced to by Ursula's last post. =
=C2=A0I only said what I would need to quantify before I start posting imag=
es. =C2=A0And you have really jumped the shark here, Frank, and I have no i=
dea why.


Tim

=C2=A0
=C2=A0I with Hultay, shut down the group=

On Su=
n, Dec 19, 2010 at 7:31 AM, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


=
=C2=A0 



Relax Ursula. 


I too have been aware of this at Keith's site f=
or long, long time, but like I said in the last post, I am very new to this=
 as in doing it on my own computer. =C2=A0Just like you. =C2=A0So don't act=
 like you know what I do and do not know, thank you very much. =C2=A0


I a=
m not attacking you so back the hell off. =C2=A0I made it clear that this w=
as for my own own edification, for me to accept my own images.=C2=A0=C2=A0
=


The image I ever so briefly mentioned the one posted that had several "Fa=
ces" or pieces thereof that were circled. =C2=A0As for your image of the ma=
n peeking out, I saw nothing there. =C2=A0Period. =C2=A0=C2=A0Did I say pre=
viously what I thought about the quality of the images in that photo? =C2=
=A0No. =C2=A0I politely kept it to myself because I do not like to differ w=
ith people or to deflate hot air balloons. =C2=A0But there you have it, tha=
t is what I saw. =C2=A0And to my knowledge, that is the only time I have de=
scribed what I have seen thus far in your images other than mentioning the =
word "eyebrows." =C2=A0In the one that had many circles, I saw one that loo=
ked like a set of lips and a chin and the rest I personally thought was mat=
rixing. =C2=A0Once again, did I saw this? =C2=A0No. =C2=A0But you asked for=
 it so there it is.


The whole point of my post, had you read it with a cl=
ear head. =C2=A0It was all about my own edification, that I, and I alone, n=
eed to keep plugging in files before I, and I alone, make a judgement about=
 MY images and whether they are real or not based upon the images they prov=
ide in contrast to the bulk of other files. =C2=A0If you simply compare you=
r one image with the many circles to the youtube file, I suspect I am corre=
ct in saying that faces occur with much more rarity than your circle file a=
nd that they can appear fully formed. =C2=A0Once again, I suspect, only, an=
d I will only be able to tell after time. =C2=A0Sample size is everything, =
and I thought I made that abundantly clear. =C2=A0The post was simply about=
 my process of learning rather than running out and saying look what I foun=
d when I simply don't know what has been found yet because it is the first =
time I have played with the controls rather than seeing the end snapshots o=
n another persons website. =C2=A0


Why do you always jump on the defensive=
 and attack every one who does not fall in line with you? =C2=A0Not everyth=
ing has to be fight or flight, Ursula, and not every bridge has to be burne=
d so thoroughly to the ground. =C2=A0This is not an attack on you or result=
s, reread the post, and this time thinking a little more clearly about what=
 is written on the page and not your own emotional backlash construing thin=
gs in the posted text that are simply not there. =C2=A0Had you done this, y=
ou would have seen the point of my post was not an attack on you, in ANY wa=
y. =C2=A0 =C2=A0


Tim

--- On Sat, 12/18/10, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:

=

From: Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: ok =
so im getting stuff on the spectergram
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Sa=
turday, December 18, 2010, 4:57 PM


=C2=A0 

No, I don't think I am being =
too critical, but I may have expectations that are a little too high. =C2=
=A0I want to take my time with this. =C2=A0For my own understanding, I need=
 to have a large sample size so I know not only what to expect to see, but =
what to look for. =C2=A0I have seen ITC snapshots from programs like this t=
hat offer full faces. =C2=A0I would be more inclined to believe in such an =
image as opposed to, lets say. two dark lines that may or may not be eyebro=
ws. 


Even in your example of the towel, you get half a face. =C2=A0If you=
 have half a face (on the vertical plane, not the horizontal) you can extra=
polate out what the entire face would look like. =C2=A0This is something I =
would like to get myself and I would consider that evidence if it showed up=
 in one of these programs. =C2=A0But, if you have something that looks like=
 a forehead and that is all there is, then it could also look like a rock o=
r some other such object.


I am certainly hoping for results worked into b=
ox sessions. =C2=A0Directing a session with intent, like saying "I am going=
 to examine the sound waves of this communication in hopes of seeing your f=
ace. =C2=A0Is it possible you can show your face to me now through sound? "=
 is what I am after. =C2=A0If a positive hit like this happens, then I will=
 be jumping for joy. =C2=A0Another good example would be a name, lets say T=
om, that occurs. =C2=A0If you get a positive affirmation that the name you =
heard is present, then you try the same technique only you address Tom by n=
ame and get a face, that would be even better.


But, as it stands now, the=
 faces as they appear are random at best. =C2=A0I would be more inclined to=
 believe that when these faces do occur , they are going to occur with a le=
sser frequency than multiple images in a few seconds of audio like Ursula's=
 example. =C2=A0If this where the case, there would be dozens, and possibly=
 hundreds, of faces during a ten minute session and I just don't think that=
 is possible. =C2=A0This is why I need to look at several samples to find o=
ut if this is the case or not. =C2=A0If these partialized faces occur in mu=
ltiples all the time, I would be more apt to discount it. =C2=A0But, if the=
y are a rarity affixed to only a few clips out of dozens, I would be more i=
nclined to believe in them. =C2=A0Sample size is everything. =C2=A0It is li=
ke listening to GBC. =C2=A0If you have never done a session before, you wou=
ld be inclined to believe every stray radio signal is a communication. =C2=
=A0Only by continued practice (expanding your sample size) can you start to=

 rule out stray radio with any degree of accuracy. =C2=A0


On the other h=
and, I am very new to this and I could certainly be wrong. =C2=A0I will con=
tinue to plug sound into the programs and hope for the best. =C2=A0


I rea=
lly want this to work. =C2=A0As you have probably experienced, when they wa=
nt you to hear something or know something, they make it very obvious while=
 communicating. =C2=A0I am hoping they apply this same rigor to this new fo=
rmat to show us that they are there. =C2=A0If they can, then the world of v=
ideo and audio ITC will merge in one source and then the skeptics be damned=
!


Tim


On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 2:24 PM, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@=
gmail.com> wrote:


=C2=A0 




=C2=A0I think it's unrealistic to expect ev=
ery file to have faces and images. These faces are often just portions, eye=
s and lips, some have eye brows. Like all of this, not done for proof, it's=
 for emotional impact.=C2=A0 I have this woman that shows up in towels, alw=
ays just half the face. Perahps you are being too critical? As with all spi=
rit messages, it's what it means to the experiencer that matters. Expecting=
 full faces is like expecting the kings english and proper grammer in all E=
VPs. 
=C2=A0
F-S





On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 3:07 AM, Tim Woolworth <tjwoo=
lworth@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I saw a couple which could be constru=
ed as images in the one series you had from SEA, but nothing that knocked m=
e over the head yet. =C2=A0I am going to have to see a larger sample size b=
efore I determine if what you have witnessed is in fact a form or not. =C2=
=A0I cannot accept an image as paranormal without knowing where it sits amo=
ng the bulk of audio files. =C2=A0If every file has multiple faces, the I w=
ould have =C2=A0to say that there is nothing there. 


So, I will certainly=
 keep testing with my copy and hopefully something will really pop for me. =
=C2=A0I have run through about ten files (EVP and GBC) so far for intensive=
 study and I still haven't got anything that I would consider a positive hi=
t. =C2=A0I need an actual formed face, not portions thereof, to consider an=
 image real. =C2=A0This is the only way to discount visual matrixing.


I h=
ave high hopes for this though!


Tim

=C2=A0 



I've seen live webcast of ITC sessions where GB out=
put is fed directly into the mic line in on a computer running Adobe Auditi=
on with the spectragraph running. It was really compelling to see letters a=
nd numbers, not images or pictures, but partial words appear in the graph. =
At first it was I thought it was a software glitch but it is a repeatable e=
vent. It was on LiveSciFi which is run by Tim Wood, he also thought there w=
as some kind of code error but it happened on more than one webcast. 

So i=
f anyone has Audition, just feed Box output right in your computer and see =
what happens. I wanted to try it tonight but I have Audacity and the spectr=
agraph feature doesn't have that shaded appearance that Audition does so it=
's not able to render images or characters, at least as far as I see using =
the various settings.

<DIV>
<DIV>No,=
 I don't think I am being too critical, but I may have expectations that ar=
e a little too high.  I want to take my time with this.  For my o=
wn understanding, I need to have a large sample size so I know not only wha=
t to expect to see, but what to look for.  I have seen ITC snapshots f=
rom programs like this that offer full faces.  I would be more incline=
d to believe in such an image as opposed to, lets say. two dark lines that =
may or may not be eyebrows. 
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Even in your example of t=
he towel, you get half a face.  If you have half a face (on the vertic=
al plane, not the horizontal) you can extrapolate out what the entire face =
would look like.  This is something I would like to get myself and I w=
ould consider that evidence if it showed up in one of these programs. &nbsp=
;But, if you have something that looks like a forehead and that is all ther=
e is, then it could also look like a rock or some other such object.</DIV>
=
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I am certainly hoping for results worked into box sess=
ions.  Directing a session with intent, like saying "I am going to exa=
mine the sound waves of this communication in hopes of seeing your face. &n=
bsp;Is it possible you can show your face to me now through sound? " is wha=
t I am after.  If a positive hit like this happens, then I will be jum=
ping for joy.  Another good example would be a name, lets say Tom, tha=
t occurs.  If you get a positive affirmation that the name you heard i=
s present, then you try the same technique only you address Tom by name and=
 get a face, that would be even better.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>But, as =
it stands now, the faces as they appear are random at best.  I would b=
e more inclined to believe that when these faces do occur , they are going =
to occur with a lesser frequency than multiple images in a few seconds of a=
udio like Ursula's example.  If this where the case, there would be do=
zens, and possibly hundreds, of faces during a ten minute session and I jus=
t don't think that is possible.  This is why I need to look at several=
 samples to find out if this is the case or not.  If these partialized=
 faces occur in multiples all the time, I would be more apt to discount it.=
  But, if they are a rarity affixed to only a few clips out of dozens,=
 I would be more inclined to believe in them.  Sample size is everythi=
ng.  It is like listening to GBC.  If you have never done a sessi=
on before, you would be inclined to believe every stray radio signal is a c=
ommunication.  Only by continued practice
 (expanding your sample size=
) can you start to rule out stray radio with any degree of accuracy.  =
</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>On the other hand, I am very new to this and I =
could certainly be wrong.  I will continue to plug sound into the prog=
rams and hope for the best.  </DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I really want=
 this to work.  As you have probably experienced, when they want you t=
o hear something or know something, they make it very obvious while communi=
cating.  I am hoping they apply this same rigor to this new format to =
show us that they are there.  If they can, then the world of video and=
 audio ITC will merge in one source and then the skeptics be damned!</DIV>
=
<DIV><BR></DIV>
